insurer_name: Millennium Insurance Company Limited (underwritten by Novus Underwriting Limited on behalf of Millennium Insurance Company Limited; provided by Stubben Edge)
coverage_summary: This insurance provides cover for an approved engineer's callout charges, labour, parts and materials following certain sudden and unexpected events occurring at your home which, if not dealt with quickly, would cause damage or further damage, or make your home insecure or unsafe, or cause a health or safety risk to you or others.
key_inclusions: Plumbing failures - internal plumbing system including toilets causing water leakage, flooding or water damage
Internal and external drainage system failures - blocked toilets, leaking tanks/cylinders, total blockage of all sinks, blocked external drains
Electrical emergency - breakdown or failure of permanent domestic electrical wiring system and components
Emergency boiler - mechanical or electrical failure resulting in system becoming completely unusable
Domestic central heating system cover - mechanical or electrical failure or malfunction resulting in complete unusability
Alternative heating costs contribution of £40 if spare parts needed and heating cannot be reinstated within 60 hours
Security incidents - making home secure following break-in, boarding broken glazing, repairing/replacing broken locks
Roofing - cover to protect roof from further damage due to bad weather
Lost or stolen keys - cover to gain access to home, replacing locks and keys
Pest infestation - removal/extermination of black or brown rats, field or house mice, wasps' or hornets' nests
Alternative accommodation contribution up to £250 if home uninhabitable for more than 48 hours
key_exclusions: Pipework outside the boundary of your home
Leaks from household appliances, sinks, baths, or showers where the leak only occurs when the item is in use
Frozen pipes which have not caused any damage
Guttering or rainwater downpipes, rainwater drains and soakaways
Blocked toilets that are not leaking or overflowing, and where there is another available toilet in the home
Repairs if your boiler is deemed beyond economical repair
Domestic appliances or items with a plug (electrical cover)

Swimming pools, fish tanks, ponds, burglar and smoke alarms, satellite/TV equipment, doorbells, garage doors, shower units, portable and fixed heating systems, immersion heaters, power generating systems including solar panels and wind turbines, any 3 phase electrical systems or garden areas (electrical cover)
Collapsed drains
Any external gas supply pipe or any piping that is the responsibility of the National Grid
Pest infestations outside the main house (e.g., garages, other outbuildings or garden)
Where an appliance has caused a circuit to fail or trip
Any incident within the initial exclusion period (first 14 days) after the start date of policy
Any item or system which has not been regularly maintained and/or serviced in accordance with manufacturer's instructions or recommendations
Claims arising whilst or immediately after your home has been left unoccupied for 60 or more consecutive days
Any work carried out by you or any other person which was not authorised by the claims administrator in advance
Any parts or item which may need to be replaced due to natural wear and tear and/or gradual deterioration
Boilers over 15 years old or with output exceeding 60kW/hr
Boilers not serviced within 12 months before insurance starts or not serviced in line with manufacturer's recommendations
Any repair/replacement whilst your boiler is still covered under a warranty

coverage_limits.annual_claim_limit: Maximum of 3 claims during any 12 months period of insurance
coverage_limits.alternative_heating_contribution: £40 towards alternative heating costs if heating cannot be reinstated within 60 hours
coverage_limits.alternative_accommodation: Up to £250 contribution if home uninhabitable for more than 48 hours

sub_limits.alternative_heating: £40 contribution only when spare parts needed and engineer cannot reinstate heating within 60 hours
sub_limits.alternative_accommodation_coverage: £250 maximum - covers hotel room(s) and transport to hotel only

special_conditions: Policy only covers emergencies - no cover for routine maintenance, cleaning or servicing
Policy provides temporary repair to limit/prevent damage or, at claims administrator's discretion, replacement of damaged part or item
Boilers must be under 15 years old with output of 60kW/hr or less
Boilers must have been serviced within 12 months before insurance starts and/or serviced in line with manufacturer's recommendations
Boilers must be serviced within 12-month period prior to an emergency occurring
All reasonable precautions must be taken to prevent an emergency
Normal day-to-day maintenance of home must be undertaken and home must be in good condition
Major emergencies which could result in serious injury to the public or damage to property should be immediately advised to the supply company and/or public emergency services
Alternative accommodation costs must be paid initially by policyholder then claimed for reimbursement
excess_deductible: £50 excess per claim - must be paid to claims administrator before any assistance can be provided
geographical_coverage: England, Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland
age_restrictions: Boilers must be under 15 years old to be covered
pre_existing_conditions: Not applicable for home emergency insurance
cancellation_policy: 14-day cooling off period from date of purchase or receipt of policy documents (whichever is later) - full refund of premium unless claim made or incident likely to result in claim. After cooling off period, can cancel anytime but no refund of premium will be payable.

claims_requirements.notification_timeframe: As soon as reasonably possible - major emergencies which could result in serious injury to the public or damage to property should be immediately advised to the supply company and/or the public emergency services
required_documents: Evidence of boiler service within 12 months prior to policy start date (for boiler claims)
Evidence of boiler service in line with manufacturer's recommendations (for boiler claims)
Claim form for reimbursement (for alternative accommodation)
Receipts/invoices for alternative accommodation and transport costs
process_steps: Report emergency to claims administrator as soon as reasonably possible
All requests for assistance must be made through the claims administrator
Pay £50 excess to claims administrator before assistance provided
Await authorization from claims administrator before any work is carried out
For alternative accommodation: pay costs initially, then submit claim form to claims administrator for reimbursement
claims_requirements.evidence_requirements: Boiler service records (within 12 months prior to policy start and/or in line with manufacturer's recommendations); receipts for alternative accommodation and transport costs
claims_requirements.claims_contact: Claims administrator (specific contact details not provided in this document)

eligibility_criteria.age_limits: No age limits for policyholders; boilers must be under 15 years old
eligibility_criteria.residency_requirements: Property must be located in England, Scotland, Wales or Northern Ireland
other_restrictions: Must ensure you and your home are eligible for this insurance - eligibility requirements advised when applying/purchasing
Home must be in good condition with normal day-to-day maintenance undertaken
Boiler must have been serviced within 12 months prior to policy start date
Boiler must be serviced in line with manufacturer's recommendations
Boiler output must be 60kW/hr or less
Home must not be left unoccupied for 60 or more consecutive days

policy_definitions.emergency: Certain sudden and unexpected events occurring at your home which, if not dealt with quickly, would cause damage or further damage, or make your home insecure or unsafe, or cause a health or safety risk to you or others
policy_definitions.completely unusable: When domestic central heating system experiences mechanical or electrical failure or malfunction resulting in the system becoming completely unusable
policy_definitions.beyond economical repair: When a boiler is deemed not cost-effective to repair (excluded from cover)
policy_definitions.temporary repair: Repair to limit or prevent damage, or at claims administrator's discretion, replacement of damaged part or item
policy_definitions.unoccupied: Home left vacant for 60 or more consecutive days
policy_definitions.natural wear and tear: Parts or items that need replacement due to gradual deterioration over time (excluded)
policy_definitions.initial exclusion period: First 14 days from the start date of policy - incidents during this period are not covered
policy_definitions.cooling off period: 14 days from date of purchase or receipt of policy documents (whichever is later)

time_sensitive_requirements.waiting_periods: 14-day initial exclusion period - any incident within first 14 days from policy start date is not covered
time_sensitive_requirements.notification_deadlines: Report emergency as soon as reasonably possible; major emergencies immediately to supply company/public emergency services
time_sensitive_requirements.cooling_off_period: 14 days from date of purchase or receipt of policy documents (whichever is later) for full refund

common_questions.question: Does this policy cover routine maintenance and servicing?
common_questions.answer: No. The policy only covers emergencies. There is no cover for routine maintenance of the items covered under the policy, nor for cleaning or servicing.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Will my boiler be repaired or replaced?
common_questions.answer: This policy will provide a temporary repair to limit or prevent damage or, solely at the claims administrator's discretion, a replacement of a damaged part or item. If your boiler is deemed beyond economical repair, there is no cover.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover? / What is not insured?

common_questions.question: How many claims can I make?
common_questions.answer: You can make a maximum of 3 claims during any 12 months period of insurance, with a limit of £1,000 per claim.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Is there an excess to pay?
common_questions.answer: Yes. You will need to pay the first £50 of each claim you make under the policy. The claims administrator will need to take the payment before any assistance can be provided to you.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Are there any waiting periods?
common_questions.answer: Yes. Any incident which happens within the first 14 days from the start date of your policy is not covered.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover? / What is not insured?

common_questions.question: Does my boiler need to be serviced to be covered?
common_questions.answer: Yes. Boilers must have been serviced within the 12 months before the insurance starts and/or serviced in line with the manufacturer's recommendations. Additionally, boilers must be serviced within the 12-month period prior to an emergency occurring.
common_questions.section_reference: What are my obligations? / Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Is my 20-year-old boiler covered?
common_questions.answer: No. We will only cover boilers under 15 years old and which have an output of 60kW/hr or less.
common_questions.section_reference: Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: What if I'm going on holiday for two months?
common_questions.answer: There is no cover for claims arising whilst or immediately after your home has been left unoccupied for 60 or more consecutive days.

common_questions.question: Can I get emergency help if I have a leaking tap?
common_questions.answer: No. Leaks from household appliances, sinks, baths, or showers where the leak only occurs when the item is in use are not covered.

common_questions.question: How does alternative accommodation work?
common_questions.answer: If your home becomes uninhabitable for more than 48 hours because of a covered emergency, you can claim up to £250. This covers hotel room(s) and transport to the hotel only. You must pay the costs initially and then submit a claim form to the claims administrator for reimbursement.
common_questions.section_reference: What is insured? / Are there any restrictions on cover?

common_questions.question: Can I use my own engineer?
common_questions.answer: No. Any work carried out by you or any other person which was not authorised by the claims administrator in advance is excluded. All requests for assistance must be made through the claims administrator.
common_questions.section_reference: What is not insured? / When making a claim

common_questions.question: What if my blocked toilet isn't overflowing and I have another toilet?
common_questions.answer: This is not covered. Blocked toilets that are not leaking or overflowing, and where there is another available toilet in the home, are excluded.
